intro: Hippocratea volkii, commonly known as the Volk's hippocratea, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and limited natural propagation, it is considered endangered in its native range.
